title: 11-Year-Old Boy Allegedly Shoots and Kills Home Intruder, 16: Police
content:
Questions surround the shooting of a teen by an 11-year-old boy at a Missouri…  
An 11-year-old boy shot and killed a 16-year-old intruder who was trying to break into his home in St. Louis, Missouri, police say. 

Police responded to a report of a shooting at a home in the Castle Point neighborhood on Thursday afternoon to find the teenager dead inside, Sgt. Brian Schellman told the Associated Press. 

Police believe teen made it inside the home on Thursday. However, there were no signs of forced entry and the door to the home was unlocked, authorities say. The suspect was with someone else who fled and was found shortly after. 

Schellman says a 4-year-old girl was also home. Neither she nor the 11-year-old boy were injured. 

The children's mother was not home at the time of the shooting but is cooperating with the investigation. She told police she had purchased the gun for protection because of previous break-in attempts, the St. Louis Post-Dispatch reports. 

"It's troubling to say the least and shows that too many young people have access to handguns and the results are usually tragic," Schellman said in a statement. 

Sharon Taylor, a relative of the boy, lives next door and says he is "very respectful" and not a problem child, though she doesn't believe the home-invasion account.…
